SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

org.jgentleframework.integration.remoting.rmi.annotation
Annotation Type RmiBinding

@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=TYPE)
public @interface RmiBinding

This annotation provides all information about specified RMI service binder in order to bind to RMI service.

Author:
LE QUOC CHUNG - mailto: skydunkpro@yahoo.com
See Also:
RmiExporting

Required Element Summary
 java.lang.String serviceName
          Service name.
 
Optional Element Summary
 boolean cacheStub
          If true, the container will automate cache RMI stub whenever invoking.
 boolean lookupStubOnStartup
          To enable lazy lookup of the service stub, set this flag to false.
 boolean refreshStubOnConnectFailure
          As indicated, RMI stubs are connected to a specific endpoint, rather than just opening a connection to a given target address for each invocation.
 java.lang.String registryHost
          Registry host.
 int registryPort
          Registry port.
 

Element Detail

serviceName

public abstract java.lang.String serviceName
Service name.

cacheStub

public abstract boolean cacheStub
If true, the container will automate cache RMI stub whenever invoking. This is usually a good thing because the stub will be ensure that it's always newest. But in this case, this is clearly not desirable from a performance perspective. In order to increase more performance, you can disable this feature by set false.

Default value is true

Default:
true

lookupStubOnStartup

public abstract boolean lookupStubOnStartup
To enable lazy lookup of the service stub, set this flag to false. The RMI stub will then be looked up on first access, that is, when the first method invocation on the proxy comes in; it will be cached from then on. The disadvantage is that there will be no validation that the target service actually exists until the first invocation.

Specifies true will automate lookup stub on startup.

Default value is true.

Default:
true

refreshStubOnConnectFailure

public abstract boolean refreshStubOnConnectFailure
As indicated, RMI stubs are connected to a specific endpoint, rather than just opening a connection to a given target address for each invocation. Consequently, if you restart the server that hosts the RMI endpoints, you need to re-register the stubs — and clients need to look them up again. While the re-registration of the target service usually happens automatically on restart, stubs held by clients become stale in such a scenario. Clients won't notice this unless they try to call a method on the stub again, which will fail with a connect exception.

To avoid this scenario, sets this flag to true to enforce automatic re-lookup of the stub if a call fails with a connect exception.

Default value is false.

Default:
false

registryHost

public abstract java.lang.String registryHost
Registry host. Default value is localhost.

Default:
""

registryPort

public abstract int registryPort
Registry port. Default value is default port 1099.

Default:
1099
